Description: Black-topped red ware bowl of fine Nile silt, with convex sides, rounded base, mouth is oval, not round. The exterior is combed and the red and blackened slip has been polished to create a rippling effect. The interior walls are black and burnished, the base is decorated with single palm branch running lengthwise made by burnishing. The rim is milled made by burnishing. The rim is milled.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (p. 22; pl. xiv. BR30E)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
